approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: The project aims to create a portal/dashboard for the VKYC team to easily fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements, eliminating the current manual request process to the IT data server team. The portal will allow searching by date, month, and LAN ID, and support bulk downloads of recordings.
project_goals: To fetch V-KYC recording for audit and internal requirements.
target_audience: Leads of VKYC process (TL & Process Manager)
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to obtain VKYC recordings, which are stored on the LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server. This manual process is inefficient and time-consuming for internal and external (Audit) requirements.

requirements.description: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for VKYC recording access.
Access to the portal shall be provided to the leads of VKYC process (TL & Process Manager).
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be fetched as and when required.
Recordings shall be available date, month wise.
Recordings shall be visible if searched by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing up to 50 LAN IDs for which they require video recordings.
Once the file is uploaded, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the request.
Upon receiving the response from the backend, the results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The results display shall be accompanied by a 'Download All' option.
The table pagination will display only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records at a time will be downloaded.
The uploaded file for bulk download must be in CSV or TXT format.
The uploaded file must contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Upon clicking a specific LAN ID, the corresponding recording download shall start.
The access for the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team Leaders).

functional_requirements: A portal/Dashboard to be created for VKYC recording access.
Access to the portal shall be provided to the leads of VKYC process (TL & Process Manager).
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be fetched as and when required.
Recordings shall be available date, month wise.
Recordings shall be visible if searched by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing up to 50 LAN IDs for which they require video recordings.
Once the file is uploaded, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the request.
Upon receiving the response from the backend, the results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The results display shall be accompanied by a 'Download All' option.
The table pagination will display only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records at a time will be downloaded.
The uploaded file for bulk download must be in CSV or TXT format.
The uploaded file must contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Upon clicking a specific LAN ID, the corresponding recording download shall start.
non_functional_requirements: The access for the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team Leaders).
stakeholders: VKYC Team (Business Unit Name, Process Owner)
IT data server team (Current provider of recordings)
success_criteria: V-KYC recordings can be fetched easily and efficiently by authorized VKYC leads.
The manual request process to the IT data server team for VKYC recordings is eliminated.
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings are accessible on the portal.
Users can search recordings by date, month, and LAN ID.
Bulk download functionality for up to 50 LAN IDs is available and functional.
constraints: The uploaded file for bulk video download must contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file must be in CSV or TXT format.
Table pagination will display only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records at a time will be downloaded.
Access to the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team Leaders).
VKYC recordings are currently present at LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server.
assumptions: The backend API for processing video requests is available or will be developed.
The existing VKYC recordings on the NFS server are accessible programmatically.
LAN IDs are unique and reliable identifiers for VKYC cases.
The definition of 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' is clear and consistent.
The current manual process is a significant bottleneck that justifies automation.
risks: Data security and privacy concerns for VKYC recordings if not properly secured on the portal.
Performance issues with fetching/downloading large volumes of video data from the NFS server.
Integration challenges with the existing NFS server and backend APIs.
User adoption issues if the portal is not user-friendly or reliable.
Accuracy of LAN ID mapping to video recordings.

domain_specific_details.NFS (Network File System) server: Existing storage location for VKYC recordings.
domain_specific_details.LTF: Likely refers to L&T Finance (implied from sample screen).
domain_specific_details.Audit requirements: Primary driver for the project, necessitating easy access to recordings.

recommendations: Clearly define all non-functional requirements, including performance (e.g., response times for search/download), scalability, detailed security (beyond access control), and availability.

Clarify the 'Download All' functionality: Does it truly download all displayed records (10 at a time) or does it queue a bulk download of all records matching the search criteria (up to 50 LAN IDs from the file upload)?
Specify error handling mechanisms for file uploads (e.g., invalid file format, exceeding 50 LAN IDs, non-existent LAN IDs).
Detail the user interface/user experience (UI/UX) requirements, especially for the bulk upload and download process.
Add explicit reporting requirements if any, as the document states 'NA' but audit needs might imply some reporting on access/downloads.
Provide more detail on the backend API integration, including data formats and expected response times.
Define data retention policies for the VKYC recordings on the portal.

identified_gaps: Lack of explicit non-functional requirements (performance, scalability, detailed security, audit trails for portal usage).
Ambiguity in the 'Download All' functionality (does it download all 10 displayed or all 50 from the uploaded file in batches of 10?).
No specific error handling requirements for file uploads or API calls.
No detailed UI/UX specifications beyond a basic wireframe.
No explicit reporting requirements (stated as NA, but audit requirements might imply some reporting on access/downloads).
No details on data retention or archival for the portal.
No explicit mention of how the 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)' will be used or displayed on the portal.
No clear definition of 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' beyond the scope statement.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct workshops with stakeholders to gather detailed non-functional requirements.
Clarify and refine the 'Download All' functionality with users to ensure it meets their expectations for bulk operations.
Define specific error messages and recovery procedures for all user interactions and system integrations.
Develop detailed wireframes and mockups for the portal interface.
Re-evaluate if any reporting requirements are needed for audit or operational purposes, even if not directly for 'Reporting Requirements' section.
Define data retention and archival policies for the VKYC recordings on the portal, including how long they should be accessible.
Specify the purpose and usage of the 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date' field in the context of the portal.
Provide a clear definition or source for 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' to ensure consistent data retrieval.
